summary: This document is a memorandum opinion from the Intermediate Court of Appeals of Hawaii regarding an appeal by Tom Donnan against an injunction granted to Robert Coello. The court upheld the injunction, finding sufficient evidence of harassment by Donnan towards Coello and his associates, and addressed various legal arguments raised by Donnan regarding jurisdiction and due process. This document contains a comprehensive report on Jeffrey Epstein, detailing various aspects of his personal information, including possible addresses, property ownership, and vehicle registrations. It highlights significant financial details related to his properties and provides insights into his potential risk factors as identified by SAFESCAN services.

persons.context: Coello filed a petition for an injunction against harassment due to alleged ongoing harassment from Donnan and his associates.

persons.name: Tom Donnan
persons.context: Donnan is appealing the injunction granted against him, arguing that it violates his constitutional rights and lacks jurisdiction.

persons.name: Malou Mallison
persons.context: Mallison was a friend of Donnan who was evicted from Coello's property, which contributed to the conflict between Coello and Donnan.

persons.context: Percy is mentioned as an immediate friend of Donnan who allegedly instigated harassment towards Coello.

persons.context: Sarah is mentioned as a young female who was allegedly threatened and harassed by Donnan and his friends.

events.title: Filing of Petition for Injunction
events.description: Coello filed a petition for an ex parte temporary restraining order and injunction against harassment.

events.title: Hearing on Temporary Restraining Order
events.description: A hearing was held regarding the temporary restraining order filed by Coello against Donnan.

events.title: Injunction Granted
events.description: The district court granted the injunction against Donnan for a period of three years.

events.title: Notice of Appeal Filed
events.description: Donnan filed a notice of appeal against the injunction granted to Coello.

locations: 358 El Brillo Way, Palm Beach, FL 33480
keyFacts: The court upheld the injunction against Tom Donnan for harassment towards Robert Coello and his associates.
Donnan's appeal included claims of lack of jurisdiction and violation of constitutional rights.
Coello documented harassment through video evidence and testimony from witnesses.
The court found that Donnan's actions constituted harassment as defined by Hawaii law.
Donnan was not denied due process, as he had opportunities to present his case.
Jeffrey Epstein owns a property at 358 El Brillo Way, Palm Beach, FL, with a total assessed value of approximately $7.88 million.
The property was last sold for $2.5 million on September 20, 1990.
Epstein has multiple vehicles registered at his addresses, including a 1998 Mercedes-Benz SL600.
The report indicates potential high-risk addresses associated with Epstein's history.
There are multiple records of possible driver licenses and addresses associated with Epstein, indicating a complex personal history.
